isTransient().Description: Returns true if the codec exception is a transient issue, perhaps due to resource constraints, and that the method (or encoding/decoding) may be retried at a later time.

isRecoverable().Description: Returns true if the codec cannot proceed further, but can be recovered by stopping, configuring, and starting again.

getErrorCode().Description: Retrieve the error code associated with a CodecException

Returns: This value will never be null.
getDiagnosticInfo().Description: Retrieve a developer-readable diagnostic information string associated with the exception. Do not show this to end-users, since this string will not be localized or generally comprehensible to end-users.

ClassDesc: Thrown when an internal codec error occurs.
